discussion.content: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/set-up-queues-manage-activities-cases

In Dynamics 365 for Customer Service, activities and cases can be categorized by using queues as follows:

Queues for activities: When an activity is created, it can be added to a specific queue. The activity can then be assigned to a user or team that has access to the queue. This helps to categorize and prioritize the activities based on their type or purpose.

Queues for cases: When a case is created, it can be added to a specific queue based on its type or priority. The case can then be assigned to a user or team that has access to the queue. This helps to categorize and prioritize the cases based on their type or priority.

By categorizing activities and cases using queues, it becomes easier to manage and prioritize work based on its type, purpose, or priority. This helps to ensure that work is completed efficiently and effectively, while also ensuring that the most important work is given the necessary attention and resources.

questions.question_text:
You are a customer service schedule administrator.

A customer has a custom entity that requires its own schedule board.

You need to create the schedule board. You configure the custom entity in the Resource Scheduling parameters.

What should you do next?

choices.C: Disable the schedule board. Configure Resource Scheduling Optimization.
choices.B: Change the default entity name to the custom name. Create a new schedule board for the custom entity.
choices.D: Configure the booking metadata. Create a new schedule board for the custom entity.
choices.A: Add a new resource requirement. Add a new view for the custom entity.
